rev.diff:
Line 45: Line 45:
== Reception and adoption ==
== Reception and adoption ==
â
''Super OS'' has been received mainly with positive reviews{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}}, with [[softpedia]] saying ''"it is a distribution with super powers [â¦] [due to] the inclusion of applications, tools and technologies that are missing from a standard Ubuntu"''.<ref>[http://news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml]</ref> ''Super OS'' (still with the name ''Super Ubuntu'' at the time), was also [[Lifehacker]]'s ''featured download'' saying "''It's basically just a re-compiled version of the official Ubuntu distribution, but with a whole bunch of features included that save you the time of grabbing them yourself''".<ref>[http://lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu]</ref>''Super OS'' is also the [[Operating System|OS]] that the Helios project<ref>[http://www.fixedbylinux.com/about www.fixedbylinux.com/about]</ref> (a non-profit organization to give away computers to children without the money to buy them) pre-loads on most of the computers they give away.<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Helios Helios at hacktolive.org]</ref><ref>[http://linuxlock.blogspot.com/2009/05/living-to-hack-and-getting-it-done.html Living To Hack and Getting It Done (official Blog of Helios project)]</ref><ref>[http://www.austin360.com/blogs/content/shared-gen/blogs/austin/digitalsavant/entries/2009/07/27/linux_against_p.html?cxntfid=blogs_digital_savant "Once the computer data is wiped, Starks and his team install Super OS, a free, open-source derivative of Ubuntu"]</ref> {{As of|2009|08}}, Super OS is in the top 300 of the page hit ranking of [[DistroWatch]], scoring #243 on the 12 month span<ref>[http://distrowatch.com/stats.php?section=popularity DistroWatch - Linux Distributions - Facts and Figures]</ref>.
+
''Super OS'' has been received mainly with positive reviews{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}}, with [[softpedia]] saying ''"it is a distribution with super powers [â¦] [due to] the inclusion of applications, tools and technologies that are missing from a standard Ubuntu"''.<ref>[http://news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml]</ref> ''Super OS'' (still with the name ''Super Ubuntu'' at the time), was also [[Lifehacker]]'s ''featured download'' saying "''It's basically just a re-compiled version of the official Ubuntu distribution, but with a whole bunch of features included that save you the time of grabbing them yourself''".<ref>[http://lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu]</ref>''Super OS'' is also the [[Operating System|OS]] that the Helios project<ref>[http://www.fixedbylinux.com/about www.fixedbylinux.com/about]</ref> (a non-profit organization to give away computers to children without the money to buy them) pre-loads on most of the computers they give away.<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Helios Helios at hacktolive.org]</ref><ref>[http://linuxlock.blogspot.com/2009/05/living-to-hack-and-getting-it-done.html Living To Hack and Getting It Done (official Blog of Helios project)]</ref><ref>[http://www.austin360.com/blogs/content/shared-gen/blogs/austin/digitalsavant/entries/2009/07/27/linux_against_p.html?cxntfid=blogs_digital_savant "Once the computer data is wiped, Starks and his team install Super OS, a free, open-source derivative of Ubuntu"]</ref> {{As of|2009|10}}, Super OS is in the top 250 of the page hit ranking of [[DistroWatch]], on the 12 month span<ref>[http://distrowatch.com/stats.php?section=popularity DistroWatch - Linux Distributions - Facts and Figures]</ref>.
